description: Hollow out a medium-sized pumpkin, removing seeds and fibers.
name: Ghapama

description: In a bowl, mix cooked rice with chopped dried fruits (apricots, prunes, raisins), nuts (almonds, walnuts), and honey.
name: Ghapama

description: Fill the pumpkin with the rice mixture and place a lid cut from the top.
name: Ghapama

description: Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) until the pumpkin is tender and the filling is heated through.
name: Ghapama

description: Serve hot, cutting the pumpkin into wedges to expose the sweet, fragrant stuffing.
name: Ghapama

description: Cook chicken in water with salt until tender and the meat falls off the bones.
name: Harissa

description: Remove the chicken, debone, and shred the meat.
name: Harissa

description: Add washed khorasan wheat to the chicken broth and cook until the wheat is soft and begins to break down.
name: Harissa

description: Add the shredded chicken back to the pot, continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the mixture becomes porridge-like.
name: Harissa

description: Serve hot, topped with melted butter and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
name: Harissa

description: Prepare the dough from flour, yeast, warm water, and salt, and let it rise until doubled in size.
name: Lahmajoun

description: Mix finely ground lamb or beef with finely diced tomatoes, bell peppers, onion, parsley, and spices.
name: Lahmajoun

description: Roll the dough into very thin circles, spread the meat mixture thinly on top.
name: Lahmajoun

description: Bake in a very hot oven for about 5 minutes until the edges are crisp and the topping is cooked.
name: Lahmajoun

description: Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon and fresh parsley.
name: Lahmajoun

description: Blanch broccoli florets in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Marinate beef slices in a mixture of soy sauce, cornstarch, and a little oil.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Heat oil in a wok, add minced garlic, and stir-fry briefly until fragrant.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Add the marinated beef and stir-fry until it starts to brown.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Add broccoli and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Pour in a mixture of beef stock, oyster sauce, and a splash of soy sauce, and cook until the sauce thickens.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Serve hot.
name: Beef and Broccoli

description: Bring chicken broth to a simmer in a pot.
name: Egg Drop Soup

description: Season the broth with soy sauce, salt, and white pepper.
name: Egg Drop Soup

description: Slowly pour beaten eggs into the simmering broth, stirring gently to form ribbons.
name: Egg Drop Soup

description: Garnish with chopped green onions and a few drops of sesame oil.
name: Egg Drop Soup

description: Serve hot.
name: Egg Drop Soup

description: Marinate chicken pieces in soy sauce and cornstarch.
name: Kung Pao Chicken

description: Heat oil in a wok and fry dried chilies until just beginning to blacken.
name: Kung Pao Chicken

description: Add chicken to the wok and stir-fry until it turns white.
name: Kung Pao Chicken

description: Add chopped bell peppers and scallions, stir-fry for a few minutes.
name: Kung Pao Chicken

description: Pour in the sauce mixture of soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and water, and cook until thickened.
name: Kung Pao Chicken

description: Stir in roasted peanuts and serve.
name: Kung Pao Chicken

description: Marinate chicken pieces in lemon juice and salt.
name: Doro Wat

description: Cook onions in a dry pot until golden, then add berbere spice and oil, cooking into a paste.
name: Doro Wat

description: Add garlic and ginger, then the marinated chicken, stirring to coat with the spice mixture.
name: Doro Wat

description: Add enough water to cover, bring to a boil, then simmer until the chicken is tender.
name: Doro Wat

description: Add hard-boiled eggs to the stew in the last 10 minutes.
name: Doro Wat

description: Serve hot with injera.
name: Doro Wat

description: Mix teff flour with water in a bowl until smooth, then cover and let ferment for 1-3 days.
name: Injera

description: After fermentation, stir the batter well and add salt.
name: Injera

description: Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.
name: Injera

description: Pour a ladleful of batter into the pan and quickly swirl to spread in a thin layer.
name: Injera

description: Cover and cook for a few minutes until holes form on the surface and edges lift from the pan.
name: Injera

description: Remove injera and let cool on a clean cloth. Repeat with remaining batter.
name: Injera

description: Finely chop or grind fresh, lean beef.
name: Kitfo

description: Melt niter kibbeh in a pan and mix with mitmita.
name: Kitfo

description: Combine the spiced butter with the raw beef, mixing thoroughly.
name: Kitfo

description: Serve immediately with injera and optional ayib (fresh cottage cheese).
name: Kitfo

description: Brown the chicken pieces in a large dutch oven.
name: Coq au Vin

description: Remove chicken and sauté onions, mushrooms, and bacon in the same pot.
name: Coq au Vin

description: Deglaze the pot with red wine and return the chicken to the pot.
name: Coq au Vin

description: Add garlic, thyme, and bay leaf. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
name: Coq au Vin

description: Thicken the sauce with a butter-flour mixture before serving.
name: Coq au Vin

description: Heat cream with vanilla bean until just hot.
name: Crème Brûlée

description: Whisk yolks with sugar until pale, then slowly add the hot cream.
name: Crème Brûlée

description: Strain the mixture into ramekins.
name: Crème Brûlée

description: Bake in a water bath until set but still trembling in the center.
name: Crème Brûlée

description: Cool, then sprinkle sugar on top and torch until caramelized.
name: Crème Brûlée

description: Caramelize the sliced onions in a large pot.
name: French Onion Soup

description: Add beef broth and bring to a simmer.
name: French Onion Soup

description: Season with thyme and bay leaves.
name: French Onion Soup

description: Toast baguette slices topped with grated cheese under a broiler until melted and golden.
name: French Onion Soup

description: Serve the soup hot with the toasted baguette.
name: French Onion Soup

description: Bake chocolate sponge cakes and let them cool.
name: Black Forest Cake

description: Cut the cakes into layers and sprinkle each with cherry schnapps.
name: Black Forest Cake

description: Whip cream with sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks form.
name: Black Forest Cake

description: Assemble the cake by alternating layers of cake with whipped cream and cherries.
name: Black Forest Cake

description: Decorate the top with whipped cream, chocolate shavings, and whole cherries.
name: Black Forest Cake

description: Chill before serving.
name: Black Forest Cake

description: Prepare the dough from flour, yeast, water, salt, and a bit of sugar.
name: Pretzels

description: Let the dough rise until doubled.
name: Pretzels

description: Divide the dough and roll each piece into a long rope, then twist into the traditional pretzel shape.
name: Pretzels

description: Dip each pretzel in a baking soda bath before baking to develop a golden and shiny crust.
name: Pretzels

description: Bake until golden brown and sprinkle with coarse salt while still warm.
name: Pretzels

description: Marinate the beef roast in a mixture of red wine, vinegar, onions, carrots, and spices for 2-3 days.
name: Sauerbraten

description: Remove the beef from the marinade, pat dry, and brown in hot oil in a heavy pot.
name: Sauerbraten

description: Strain the marinade and add it to the pot with the beef.
name: Sauerbraten

description: Add crushed ginger snaps to thicken and sweeten the sauce.
name: Sauerbraten

description: Simmer the roast slowly until it is tender.
name: Sauerbraten

description: Slice and serve the roast with the sauce poured over it.
name: Sauerbraten

description: Preheat oven and grease the baking dish.
name: Baklava

description: Layer the filo dough with melted butter and chopped nuts.
name: Baklava

description: Cut into diamond shapes before baking.
name: Baklava

description: Bake until golden and crisp.
name: Baklava

description: Pour cooled syrup over the hot baklava immediately after baking.
name: Baklava

description: Chop the cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onion.
name: Greek Salad (Horiatiki)

description: Combine vegetables in a large bowl.
name: Greek Salad (Horiatiki)

description: Top with Kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
name: Greek Salad (Horiatiki)

description: Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle oregano.
name: Greek Salad (Horiatiki)

description: Slice and salt eggplants, then fry until golden.
name: Moussaka

description: Cook ground meat with onions, garlic, and tomatoes.
name: Moussaka

description: Layer eggplant and meat mixture in a baking dish.
name: Moussaka

description: Prepare béchamel sauce and spread over the top.
name: Moussaka

description: Bake until the surface is golden and bubbly.
name: Moussaka

description: Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices for at least 2 hours.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Cook rice until it's 70% done, then drain.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Fry onions until golden, then set aside.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Layer the marinated chicken and partially cooked rice in a pot.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Add saffron infused in warm milk for color.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked and the chicken is tender.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Garnish with fried onions, nuts, and fresh cilantro.
name: Chicken Biryani

description: Peel and chop fresh mangoes.
name: Mango Lassi

description: Blend mangoes with yogurt, milk, sugar, and cardamom until smooth.
name: Mango Lassi

description: Chill in the refrigerator for at least one hour.
name: Mango Lassi

description: Serve cold garnished with a sprinkle of cardamom powder or mint leaves.
name: Mango Lassi

description: Blanch spinach in hot water, then cool and blend into a fine paste.
name: Palak Paneer

description: Fry paneer cubes until golden, set aside.
name: Palak Paneer

description: In the same pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, garlic, and ginger until soft.
name: Palak Paneer

description: Add the spinach paste, spices, and a little water to the pan.
name: Palak Paneer

description: Simmer for 10 minutes, then add fried paneer.
name: Palak Paneer

description: Cook for another 5 minutes, then serve hot with naan or rice.
name: Palak Paneer

description: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper and dredge in flour.
name: Osso Buco

description: Brown the veal shanks in a heavy pot with some olive oil.
name: Osso Buco

description: Remove shanks and sauté onions, carrots, and celery until softened.
name: Osso Buco

description: Deglaze the pot with white wine, then return the shanks to the pot.
name: Osso Buco

description: Add broth until the shanks are nearly covered, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
name: Osso Buco

description: Cover and cook slowly until the meat is tender, about 2 hours.
name: Osso Buco

description: Serve with gremolata on top.
name: Osso Buco

description: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
name: Spaghetti Carbonara

description: Render pancetta in a pan until crispy.
name: Spaghetti Carbonara

description: Whisk eggs and Parmesan cheese together in a bowl.
name: Spaghetti Carbonara

description: Drain pasta and mix into the pan with pancetta, off the heat.
name: Spaghetti Carbonara

description: Quickly add egg and cheese mixture, stirring vigorously to create a creamy sauce.
name: Spaghetti Carbonara

description: Season with freshly cracked black pepper and serve immediately.
name: Spaghetti Carbonara

description: Mix egg yolks and sugar until pale and fluffy.
name: Tiramisu

description: Fold in mascarpone cheese gently.
name: Tiramisu

description: Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixed with a splash of coffee liqueur.
name: Tiramisu

description: Layer the ladyfingers in a dish, spread over a layer of mascarpone mixture.
name: Tiramisu

description: Repeat layering and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
name: Tiramisu

description: Dust with cocoa powder before serving.
name: Tiramisu

description: Whisk together milk, cream, sugar, and matcha powder until the sugar dissolves.
name: Matcha Ice Cream

description: Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
name: Matcha Ice Cream

description: Process in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
name: Matcha Ice Cream

description: Freeze the churned ice cream until firm, about 2-3 hours.
name: Matcha Ice Cream

description: Prepare the broth by simmering chicken or pork bones with onions, garlic, and ginger.
name: Ramen

description: Strain the broth and season with soy sauce, miso, or salt.
name: Ramen

description: Cook ramen noodles separately until just tender.
name: Ramen

description: In bowls, arrange cooked noodles, then pour hot broth over them.
name: Ramen

description: Top with slices of pork belly, soft-boiled eggs, green onions, and bamboo shoots.
name: Ramen

description: Cook sushi rice and season with sushi vinegar.
name: Sushi Rolls (Maki Sushi)

description: Spread the cooled rice on a sheet of nori laid out on a bamboo mat.
name: Sushi Rolls (Maki Sushi)

description: Place fillings like cucumber, avocado, and fish along the center of the rice.
name: Sushi Rolls (Maki Sushi)

description: Roll the nori tightly using the bamboo mat, pressing firmly.
name: Sushi Rolls (Maki Sushi)

description: Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces with a sharp knife.
name: Sushi Rolls (Maki Sushi)

description: Boil large cuts of meat until tender, then remove the meat and reserve the broth.
name: Beshbarmak

description: Hand-make pasta dough, roll it out thinly, and cut into squares.
name: Beshbarmak

description: Cook the pasta squares in the remaining broth until tender.
name: Beshbarmak

description: Slice the boiled meat into bite-sized pieces.
name: Beshbarmak

description: Layer the cooked pasta on a large serving platter, top with meat pieces, then ladle hot broth over the top.
name: Beshbarmak

description: Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.
name: Beshbarmak

description: Prepare the intestines by thoroughly cleaning and then soaking in cold water.
name: Kazy

description: Cut the horse meat and fat into strips, season with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
name: Kazy

description: Stuff the seasoned meat and fat tightly into the intestines.
name: Kazy

description: Tie off the ends of the sausage and boil in water for an hour, or smoke for several hours until cooked through.
name: Kazy

description: Serve sliced with traditional sides of bread and onions.
name: Kazy

description: Drain the whey from sour milk or yogurt completely.
name: Kurt

description: Mix the curd with salt and press any remaining liquid out.
name: Kurt

description: Form the curd into small balls and cover them in cloth.
name: Kurt

description: Leave the balls to dry in a cool, ventilated area until hard.
name: Kurt

description: Store in a dry place until ready to consume.
name: Kurt

description: Marinate the meat in a mixture of lemon juice, garlic, ginger, and salt for at least 1 hour.
name: Nyama Choma

description: Prepare a charcoal grill or preheat a gas grill.
name: Nyama Choma

description: Grill the meat over medium heat, turning regularly, until well browned and cooked to desired doneness.
name: Nyama Choma

description: Rest the meat for 10 minutes before slicing.
name: Nyama Choma

description: Serve with kachumbari (a fresh tomato and onion salad) and Ugali.
name: Nyama Choma

description: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
name: Sukuma Wiki

description: Add minced garlic and continue to sauté for about 1 minute.
name: Sukuma Wiki

description: Add the chopped collard greens, stirring to combine with the onions and garlic.
name: Sukuma Wiki

description: Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cayenne for heat.
name: Sukuma Wiki

description: Cover and simmer over low heat until the greens are tender, adding a little water if necessary.
name: Sukuma Wiki

description: Serve hot with Ugali or as a side dish to any meal.
name: Sukuma Wiki

description: Bring water to a boil in a large pot.
name: Ugali

description: Slowly pour the cornmeal into the boiling water, stirring continuously with a wooden spoon.
name: Ugali

description: Continue to cook and stir until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the sides of the pot.
name: Ugali

description: Turn out the Ugali onto a plate and mold into a round shape.
name: Ugali

description: Serve hot with a stew or vegetables.
name: Ugali

description: Cook the rice according to package instructions.
name: Bibimbap

description: Prepare and sauté each vegetable separately in a pan with a small amount of oil.
name: Bibimbap

description: Marinate beef slices in soy sauce, garlic, and sesame oil, then fry until cooked.
name: Bibimbap

description: Fry an egg, keeping the yolk runny.
name: Bibimbap

description: Assemble the dish by placing rice in a bowl, arranging the vegetables and beef on top, and placing the fried egg in the center.
name: Bibimbap

description: Serve with a dollop of gochujang on the side.
name: Bibimbap

description: Prepare the dough with flour, sugar, milk, and yeast. Let it rise until doubled in size.
name: Hoddeok

description: Mix brown sugar, chopped nuts, and cinnamon for the filling.
name: Hoddeok

description: Divide the dough into balls, flatten them, and place a spoonful of filling in the center.
name: Hoddeok

description: Seal the dough around the filling and flatten into a pancake shape.
name: Hoddeok

description: Fry each pancake in a lightly oiled pan until golden brown on both sides.
name: Hoddeok

description: Serve hot, allowing the syrupy filling to ooze out when bitten.
name: Hoddeok

description: In a pot, sauté pork belly until browned, then add chopped kimchi and cook until soft.
name: Kimchi Jjigae

description: Add water or stock and bring to a boil.
name: Kimchi Jjigae

description: Season with gochujang, gochugaru (Korean chili powder), and soy sauce.
name: Kimchi Jjigae

description: Add sliced tofu and simmer until all ingredients are well-cooked.
name: Kimchi Jjigae

description: Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot with a bowl of rice.
name: Kimchi Jjigae

description: Roast poblano peppers, peel off the skin, and remove seeds.
name: Chiles en Nogada

description: Prepare the picadillo by cooking ground meat with tomatoes, apples, pears, and peaches.
name: Chiles en Nogada

description: Stuff the roasted chiles with the picadillo.
name: Chiles en Nogada

description: Prepare a sauce by blending walnuts with milk, sugar, and sherry until smooth.
name: Chiles en Nogada

description: Cover the stuffed chiles with the walnut cream sauce.
name: Chiles en Nogada

description: Garnish with pomegranate seeds and parsley before serving.
name: Chiles en Nogada

description: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
name: Flan

description: Melt sugar in a pan until golden and pour into a round baking dish, swirling to coat the bottom.
name: Flan

description: Blend eggs, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
name: Flan

description: Pour the custard mixture over the caramelized sugar.
name: Flan

description: Place the dish in a larger baking pan and fill the pan with hot water halfway up the sides of the dish.
name: Flan

description: Bake in a water bath until set, about 45 minutes.
name: Flan

description: Cool and refrigerate before serving. Invert onto a plate to serve.
name: Flan

description: Marinate thinly sliced pork in a blend of chilies, achiote paste, garlic, and pineapple juice overnight.
name: Tacos al Pastor

description: Cook the pork on a vertical spit or in a very hot skillet until charred and tender.
name: Tacos al Pastor

description: Chop the cooked pork into small pieces.
name: Tacos al Pastor

description: Warm small corn tortillas and fill with pork.
name: Tacos al Pastor

description: Top with diced pineapple, chopped onions, and fresh cilantro.
name: Tacos al Pastor

description: Serve with a squeeze of lime and salsa.
name: Tacos al Pastor

description: Preheat the oven and grease the baking dish.
name: Baklava

description: Layer the filo dough in the dish, brushing each sheet with melted butter and sprinkling chopped nuts between some of the layers.
name: Baklava

description: Cut the layered pastry into diamond or square shapes before baking.
name: Baklava

description: Bake until golden and crisp.
name: Baklava

description: Immediately after baking, pour the prepared syrup evenly over the hot baklava.
name: Baklava

description: Let cool to absorb the syrup before serving.
name: Baklava

description: Grill seasoned lamb strips until well cooked.
name: İskender Kebab

description: Toast pita bread lightly and cut into small pieces.
name: İskender Kebab

description: Place the bread in a dish and cover with grilled lamb.
name: İskender Kebab

description: Heat tomato sauce and pour over the meat.
name: İskender Kebab

description: Melt butter and drizzle over the dish.
name: İskender Kebab

description: Serve with a side of fresh yogurt.
name: İskender Kebab

description: Prepare the dough from flour, water, yeast, and salt. Let it rise for an hour.
name: Lahmacun

description: Mix minced meat with finely chopped bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, parsley, and spices.
name: Lahmacun

description: Roll out the dough into thin circles and spread the meat mixture thinly on top.
name: Lahmacun

description: Bake in a very hot oven until the edges are crisp and browned, about 5 minutes.
name: Lahmacun

description: Serve hot, rolled up with a squeeze of lemon and optional garnishes like lettuce and sliced tomatoes.
name: Lahmacun

description: Prepare the dough by mixing flour, water, salt, and a bit of oil into a smooth, elastic dough. Let it rest.
name: Gutap

description: For the filling, combine finely chopped spinach, green onions, dill, parsley, and optional cheese.
name: Gutap

description: Divide the dough into small balls, roll each out thinly, place a spoonful of filling in the center, then fold and seal the edges.
name: Gutap

description: Fry each pie in hot oil until golden brown on both sides.
name: Gutap

description: Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
name: Gutap

description: Heat oil in a large pot and brown the lamb pieces until golden.
name: Palaw

description: Add chopped onions and grated carrots to the pot and sauté until softened.
name: Palaw

description: Stir in rice, Turkmen saffron, and enough boiling water to cover the ingredients.
name: Palaw

description: Cook on low heat until the rice is fluffy and all the liquid is absorbed.
name: Palaw

description: Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs.
name: Palaw

description: In a large pot, brown the lamb pieces to develop flavor.
name: Shurpa

description: Add water and bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that forms on the surface.
name: Shurpa

description: Add chopped potatoes, carrots, onions, and bell peppers to the pot.
name: Shurpa

description: Season with salt, pepper, and a bouquet garni of local herbs.
name: Shurpa

description: Simmer gently until the meat is tender and vegetables are cooked.
name: Shurpa

description: Serve hot, sprinkled with chopped herbs like dill and parsley.
name: Shurpa

description: Soak dried fruits in hot tea the night before baking to plump them up.
name: Bara Brith

description: Mix flour, sugar, and spices in a bowl.
name: Bara Brith

description: Add the soaked fruits with any remaining tea, followed by an egg, and mix to form a dough.
name: Bara Brith

description: Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.
name: Bara Brith

description: Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 1.5 hours until risen and golden.
name: Bara Brith

description: Cool in the pan, then turn out onto a wire rack.
name: Bara Brith

description: Slice and serve with butter.
name: Bara Brith

description: In a large pot, brown the lamb pieces, then remove and set aside.
name: Cawl

description: In the same pot, sauté onions, carrots, and leeks until slightly softened.
name: Cawl

description: Return the lamb to the pot, add potatoes, and cover with water or stock.
name: Cawl

description: Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, covering and cooking for at least 3 hours until the meat is tender and the vegetables are cooked.
name: Cawl

description: Season with salt and pepper to taste, and add chopped parsley before serving.
name: Cawl

description: Serve hot, with a side of crusty bread.
name: Cawl

description: In a saucepan, melt butter and stir in the flour to make a roux.
name: Welsh Rarebit

description: Gradually add beer to the roux while continuously stirring to create a smooth sauce.
name: Welsh Rarebit

description: Add grated cheese to the saucepan, stirring until the cheese is melted.
name: Welsh Rarebit

description: Season the cheese sauce with mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
name: Welsh Rarebit

description: Pour the hot cheese sauce over slices of toasted bread.
name: Welsh Rarebit

description: Grill the topped bread under a broiler until bubbly and golden brown.
name: Welsh Rarebit

description: Serve immediately.
name: Welsh Rarebit
